intro: Echinochloa dubia, commonly known as fingergrass, is an annual grass species native to the Americas. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Echinochloa dubia is considered a weed in many regions due to its rapid growth and competitive nature.
